name: resit
content:
Add to word list

to take an exam again, usually because you failed or did not do well the first time: If you fail these exams, you can resit them next year. People have to think hard about why they want to resit.
More examplesFewer examplesTaking a year out to resit exams is a further option.I have had to resit some subject modules to improve my grades.You could resit, or take a year out.

an exam that someone takes again, usually because they failed or did not do well the first time: She's got to do resits in French and German. If I don't pass the resits, I'll have to leave university.
More examplesFewer examplesShe doesn't want to spend her gap year doing resits.I could have taken a year out for resits, but there were no guarantees I'd get the grades even then.In general students in Stage I are given resits when they do not reach a pass grade.
